ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Form used/assessment name
Notes: e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version

ElementDescription: I feel left out
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Rarely; 3=Sometimes; 4=Usually; 5=Always

ElementDescription: How often have you had trouble falling asleep at bedtime?
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Not very often; 3 =Sometimes; 4 =Usually; 5 =Always;

ElementDescription: In the past 7 days...I felt worthless
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Rarely; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often; 5 = Always; -5= Item seen but not answered; -999= Data not submitted (incomplete, item not seen)

ElementDescription: Self-report: In the past 7 days; I felt enthusiastic / Parent report: In the past 7 days, my child was enthusiastic
Notes: 1=Not at all; 2=A little bit; 3=Somewhat; 4=Quite a bit; 5=Very much

ElementDescription: In the past 7 days... I felt worried
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Rarely; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often; 5 = Always; 888 = N/A; 999 = Incomplete; -5= Item seen but not answered; -999= Data not submitted (incomplete, item not seen)

ElementDescription: Thinking about how much energy you have to do the things you want to do, I am
Notes: 1 = always full of energy; 2 = usually full of energy; 3 = occasionally energetic; 4 = usually tired and lacking energy; 5 = always tired and lacking energy

ElementDescription: Thinking about how easy or difficult it is for you to get around by yourself outside your house (e.g., shopping, visiting):
Notes: 1 = getting around is enjoyable and easy; 2 = I have no difficulty getting around outside my house; 3 = a little difficulty; 4 = moderate difficulty; 5 = a lot of difficulty; 6 = I cannot get around unless somebody is there to help me

ElementDescription: Thinking about your health and your role in your community (that is to say neighbourhood, sporting, work, church or cultural groups):
Notes: 1 = my role in the community is unaffected by my health; 2 = there are some parts of my community role I cannot carry out; 3 = there are many parts of my community role I cannot carry out; 4 = I cannot carry out any part of my community role

ElementDescription: How often do you feel sad?
Notes: 1 = never; 2 = rarely; 3 = some of the time; 4 = usually; 5 = nearly all the time

ElementDescription: Thinking about how often you experience serious pain,  I experience it:
Notes: 1 = very rarely; 2 = less than once a week; 3 = three to four times a week; 4 = most of the time

ElementDescription: How much confidence do you have in yourself?
Notes: 1 = complete confidence; 2 = a lot; 3 = a moderate amount; 4 = a little; 5 = none at all

ElementDescription: When you think about whether you are calm and tranquil or agitated, I am:
Notes: 1 = always calm and tranquil; 2 = usually calm and tranquil; 3 = sometimes calm and tranquil, sometimes agitated; 4 = usually agitated; 5 = always agitated

ElementDescription: Thinking about your health and your relationship with your family:
Notes: 1 = my role in the family is unaffected by my health; 2 = there are some parts of my family role I cannot carry out; 3 = there are many parts of my family role I cannot carry out; 4 = I cannot carry out any part of my family role

ElementDescription: Your close relationships (family and friends) are:
Notes: 1 = very satisfying; 2 = satisfying; 3 = neither satisfying nor dissatisfying; 4 = dissatisfying; 5 = unpleasant; 6 = very unpleasant

ElementDescription: When you communicate with others, e.g., by talking, listening, writing or signing:
Notes: 1 = I have no trouble speaking to them or understanding what they are saying; 2 = I have some difficulty being understood by people who do not know me. I have no trouble understanding what others are saying to me; 3 = I am understood only by people who know me well. I have great trouble understanding what others are saying to me. ; 4 = I cannot adequately communicate with others

ElementDescription: How often do you feel angry?
Notes: 1 = never; 2 = almost never; 3 = sometimes; 4 = often; 5 = all the time

ElementDescription: Thinking about your mobility, including using any aids or equipment such as wheelchairs, frames, sticks:
Notes: 1 = I am very mobile; 2 = I have no difficulty with mobility; 3 = I have some difficulty with mobility (for example, going uphill); 4 = I have difficulty with mobility. I can go short distances only. ; 5 = I have a lot of difficulty with mobility. I need someone to help me. ; 6 = I am bedridden

ElementDescription: Do you ever feel like hurting yourself?
Notes: 1 = never; 2 = almost never; 3 = sometimes; 4 = often; 5 = all the time

ElementDescription: Thinking about washing yourself, toileting, dressing, eating or looking after your appearance:
Notes: 1 = these tasks are very easy for me; 2 = I have no real difficulty in carrying out these tasks; 3 = I find some of these tasks difficult, but I manage to do them on my own; 4 = many of these tasks are difficult, and I need help to do them; 5 = I cannot do these tasks by myself at all

ElementDescription: How much do you feel you can cope with life's problems?
Notes: 1 = completely; 2 = mostly; 3 = partly; 4 = very little; 5 = not at all

ElementDescription: How much pain or discomfort do you experience?
Notes: 1 = none at all; 2 = I have moderate pain; 3 = I suffer from severe pain; 4 = I suffer unbearable pain

ElementDescription: How much do you enjoy your close relationships (family and friends)?
Notes: 1 = immensely; 2 = a lot; 3 = a little; 4 = not much; 5 = I hate it

ElementDescription: How often does pain interfere with your usual activities?
Notes: 1 = never; 2 = rarely; 3 = sometimes; 4 = often; 5 = always

ElementDescription: How often do you feel pleasure?
Notes: 1 = always; 2 = usually; 3 = sometimes; 4 = almost never; 5 = never

ElementDescription: How much of a burden do you feel you are to other people?
Notes: 1 = not at all; 2 = a little; 3 = a moderate amount; 4 = a lot; 5 = totally

ElementDescription: How content are you with your life?
Notes: 1 = extremely; 2 = mainly; 3 = moderately; 4 = slightly; 5 = not at all

ElementDescription: Thinking about your vision (using your glasses or contact lenses if needed):
Notes: 1 = I have excellent sight; 2 = I see normally; 3 = I have some difficulty focusing on things, or I do not see them sharply (e.g., small print, a newspaper or seeing objects in the distance); 4 = I have a lot of difficulty seeing things. My vision in blurred. I can see just enough to get by with.; 5 = I only see general shapes. I need a guide to move around; 6 = I am completely blind

ElementDescription: How often do you feel in control of your life?
Notes: 1 = always; 2 = mostly; 3 = sometimes; 4 = only occasionally; 5 = never

ElementDescription: How much help do you need with jobs around the house (e.g. preparing food, cleaning the house or gardening):
Notes: 1 = I can do these tasks very quickly and efficiently without any help; 2 = I can do these tasks relatively easily without help; 3 = I can do these tasks only very slowly without help; 4 = I cannot do most of these tasks unless I have help; 5 = I can do none of these tasks by myself

ElementDescription: How often do you feel socially isolated?
Notes: 1 = never; 2 = rarely; 3 = sometimes; 4 = often; 5 = always

ElementDescription: Thinking about your hearing (using your hearing aid if needed):
Notes: 1 = I have excellent hearing; 2 = I hear normally; 3 = I have some difficulty hearing, or I do not hear clearly. I have trouble hearing softly-spoken people or when there is background noise.; 4 = I have difficulty hearing things clearly. Often I do not understand what is said. I usually do not take part in conversations because I cannot hear what is said.; 5 = I hear very little indeed. I cannot fully understand loud voices speaking directly to me.; 6 = I am completely deaf

ElementDescription: How often do you feel depressed?
Notes: 1 = never; 2 = almost never; 3 = sometimes; 4 = often; 5 = very often; 6 = all the time

ElementDescription: Your close and intimate relationships (including any sexual relationships) make you:
Notes: 1 = very happy; 2 = generally happy; 3 = neither happy nor unhappy; 4 = generally happy; 5 = very unhappy

ElementDescription: How often did you feel in despair over the last seven days?
Notes: 1 = never; 2 = occasionally; 3 = sometimes; 4 = often; 5 = all the time

ElementDescription: Specify other relationship
Visit name
Notes: e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2

ElementDescription: How often do you feel happy
Notes: 5 = never; 4 = almost never; 3 = sometimes; 2 = mostly; 1 = all the time
